review_text: Nice beach but the real draw is the surf which at certain times of the year can reach epic proportions attracting some of the world's top surfers! My wife used to live in Cascais in the early 60s and would often ride horses or spend time on this beach. The area is now significantly more developed with restaurants, several  hotels and large residential developments. Oh well that's progress I guess!
Great beach, particularly for surfers. Lifeguard on duty so good for (experienced) swimmers also. Well worth a visit.
It is a famous beach frequented by tourists. the atmosphere is young and the look is breathtaking. A mandatory visit for everyone who passes through Cascais.
Surfs up!  Beautiful beach to learn how to surf. Go se Johnny at Shaka Surf School.  Easiest to get there by car, pay for parking but not expensive.

review_title: A beautiful beach worth seeing while you‚Äôre in Portugal
review_text: As we explored the western coast of Portugal, this was a beautiful beach, and a must see location. It was easy to walk around and every angle offered a stunning view to admire.

review_title: Guincho is one of the worlds unique places
review_text: This beach is very unpredictable because the weather is also unpredictable. We can have wind and a sea with a lot of swell in the morning and in the afternoon it is phenomenally hot and the sea is calm. Here is where I feel the Atlantic Ocean and where I feel zen with Nature.üåä‚õ±Ô∏è‚òÄÔ∏è

review_title: Great beach bar- fab white sangria & views
review_text: Great beach bar- lovely white sangria & food ( chicken curry mayonnaise tools) , lots of attentive  staff & great views . Visited on a windy day but sat out in the front and loved it- nice & busy- could spend days here- highly recommend a visit
The day we visited at 1130, there was only one other person on the beach. Very long and wide beach with decent waves. Windy though.

review_title: Pleasant 9 km  Cascais-Guincho Beach power walk / run / bicycle trip
review_text:
Sorry, this post is not a review of the actual beach - but it‚Äôs written to inspire you to do some nice exercise with a magnificent view all the way.

The thing is that there is a combined walking path / bicycle lane running along the coast from Cascais to Guincho Beach - 9 kilometers each way.

On the way you can:

Rent electric bikes
Rent electric kick scooters
See the famous Boca do Inferno
See the Forte de Sao Jorge
Enjoy the fresh air and brilliant views

- and you don‚Äôt have to go all the way; it‚Äôs only optional (c;

Portugal is a lovely country and nowhere is that more clear than the beaches around Cascais. Sunset lent a gorgeous light to the view and the weather even in November was perfect for an evening stroll.
It was a lovely sunny day in the beach. Lots of rocks surrounding. Portugal has the best beaches in Europe

Can't beat this beach only 40-50 minutes from Lisbon by train/Uber (less time if you drive).  It's just far enough to avoid huge crowds in a heat wave (we went on a 95F+ day), and it is a dramatic, beautiful beach with great waves and small waves alike, pristine sand.  Only downside is there are no public restrooms (contrary to what some beach review sites say).  Highly recommend!

We made a quick stop here after visiting Sintra and the beach seemed really nice. It is popular mostly for surfing as it can get quite windy here. Not sure if it would be as enjoyable for swimming given the wind, but the views were quite nice and relaxing.
Special charm of Guincho is so worth visiting-  beautiful beach even if you are not a surfing aficionado

review_title: Paradise in medium wind. Excellent bar but bike rental was tricky. Don‚Äôt use beach cruisers. Bikes have to be back by 7.
review_text: Unreal beach experience.  Well worth the trip!  The beach bar was excellent. Bike rental in Casc√°is on our day trip from Lisbon was less than ideal, however. We didn‚Äôt understand that the bikes must be returned before 7 and had to hustle our beach cruisers 6 miles back to Casc√°is to beat the clock. The bike shop staff didn‚Äôt do a good job of informing us about the situation. DONT use beach cruisers for this ride. Mountain bikes are best for the ride from Casc√°is to Guincho. Umbrella rental at Guincho beach was also more expensive than expected. The wind at Guincho was perfect when we went in late June. The surfers were not thrilled with the lack of wind but it was great for lounging on the sand.

It is very rare to have nice beach days in Guincho (specially in mid Summer) as the winds can be ferocious, but on a quiet day with no wind, this beach offers you unpararelled pleasures. Beware of the big waves and tides
Did a quick stop here while in Cascais for some photo opportunities. Lovely beach and was not too crowded, at least during the middle of the work week.

review_title: Guincho Beach - the other side of the Atlantic Ocean
review_text:
I'm from the east coast of the US and have only seen the Atlantic Ocean from there. This was a cool experience, to see and wade into the water of the Atlantic Ocean from the other side - from Guincho Beach.

I visited on a chilly day in April after a side trip to Sintra. Barely anyone was around but the waves crashing against the shore made me feel calm. Beautiful place and worth a visit.

If you don't surf, there is not much you can do, unless you want sand all over you. It's very windy and the sand stings your skin all over your body. It's not worth it and definitely won't return here. It offers a great view when going down to the beach, but that's about it.
Nice place to talk a walk and see the coast. Good spot for surfers. Not much around so if you want to spend a day bring all your own items.
One of my favorite beach - I love the vibe, views , surfing and bars . It is easily accessible from Cascais via picturesque road along the side. Especially by bike! Can you ask for more?

The scene is so breath taking, large waves, people parasailing and walking along the beach  on the walking path. Nice place to stop and have a cup of coffee and lite lunch. Watch a beautiful sunset over the beach with a glass of wine.
Guincho Beach is beautiful and worth going to have a look. there a several restaurants to choose from if you wish to make a day out of the trip.

review_title: One of the most beautiful beaches in the world
review_text: Fantastic sea, fabulous sand, beautiful landscape. Excellent for surfing, windsurfing and kite surfing! In summer time there's no better beach!!

It's lovely sandy beach which is very popular with all forms surfers because of the wind.
Roadside parking can be a problem at the weekends and during the summer. When approaching on the coast road from Cascais, park in the Mar do Guincho restaurant car park for only ‚Ç¨2 a day
If leaving on the coast road heading east after about 1630 at the weekend or during the summer, there is usually a long queue for the first roundabout on entering Cascais. To avoid this, drive slightly past the beach (on your left) and take the junction to the right as you approach the wooded area. This takes you to Birre in the northern part of Cascais, and the start of the A5 motorway.
I walked along this beach on a cold but sunny December day. Waves crashing   Beach nearly deserted.  Wonderful

Took my kids there for their first surfing lesson. It was a wintertime visit. But it was nice weather. The kid's wore wet suits and we hired a nearby surf shop. The beach is huge and beautiful. Not many people there. So, on a nice day, a December visit is ideal. I also suspect that they clean the sand because the beach was immaculate.

review_title: Spectacular Beach- not only for surfers
review_text: The natural beauty of Guincho beach is worth a visit . Nice train ride from Lisbon and a short taxi ride from the station .

Guincho beach is truly beautiful and unspoiled, pretty much deserted out of season and a must for die hard windsurfers. The water is super cold and tricky, lots of powerful currents and big waves at times. During the season there are life guards in some of the beaches but out of season no, so if you feel adventurous and go for a swim proceed with great care. Or just sit and look and the sea, it is SO amazingly beautiful. Unforgettable sunsets guaranteed too! Big sand dunes and great walks nearby, namely one which starts roughly opposite Fortaleza do Guincho (big yellow building, old fortress) with wood paths to walk on and beautiful meandering paths providing stunning views. Not to miss!
This is a fabulous occasion and although most of the restaurants are expensive, its just a short taxi ride to Cascais.
It was a lovely sunny day in the beach. Lots of rocks surrounding. Portugal has the best beaches in Europe

Can't beat this beach only 40-50 minutes from Lisbon by train/Uber (less time if you drive). Only downside is there are no public restrooms (contrary to what some beach review sites say).  Highly recommend!

We made a quick stop here after visiting Sintra and the beach seemed really nice. It is popular mostly for surfing as it can get quite windy here. Not sure if it would be as enjoyable for swimming given the wind, but the views were quite nice and relaxing.
Special charm of Guincho is so worth visiting-  beautiful beach even if you are not a surfing aficionado

The bike shop staff didn‚Äôt do a good job of informing us about the situation. DONT use beach cruisers for this ride. Mountain bikes are best for the ride from Casc√°is to Guincho.
